text:
In jakarta-log4j-1.1b6.tar.gz, a number of the files in /docs (contactUs.html, documentation.html, download.html, earlier.html, history.html, index.html) are fetching one of the images from the internet (). This would be better (at least in the downloadable docs) as a relative link to a local copy. Also, in /docs/manual.html (and in the online copy at http://jakarta.apache.org/log4j/docs/manual.html) a number of the 
 
formatted sections contain text which is marked up with  for no obvious 
reason e.g. the static keywords in the NDC definition - it can't be to 
highlight changes from an earlier version, since it's only mentioned once...

Regarding jakarta-logo.gif I contacted the person handling our www look and 
feel.

Regarding the <strong> elements within <pre>, I is to attract the users 
attention. What else? Ceki
creator: bugzilla@apache.org
jon@latchkey.com
text:
Ok, i am only responding to the images problem.



here is the crux of the problem: The documentation as generated would 

either need a local copy of the jakarta-logo.gif in all projects or i can use a 

url like i am using. 



if this is really a concern for your users ceki, then one thing that you can 

do is when you build a distribution of your project, you can use the <

replace> ant task to <replace> out the absolute url reference for a local 

one in all of the .html files and then copy the jakarta-logo.gif to a local 

directory so that it can be found by the .html files.



i'm open to suggestions for fixing this problem in such a way as to not 

require each and every project to have a local copy of that .gif file in their 

CVS tree yet still have access to the image.



my <replace> suggestion is somewhat of a hack, but it would work fine.
